analyzed: theḥ apadāna  a vaṭa phala vagga
translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about Avaṭa-fruit
The Elder Udumbaraphaladāyaka’s Story
On the bank of the Vinatā River,
the Supreme Man was dwelling;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
one-pointed, well-concentrated.

analyzed: tasmin pasanna mānasaḥ  kilesa mala dhovane
translated: With a mind full of faith,
in the washing of the stain of defilements,🔽taking a fig fruit,
I always served the Best of Buddhas.
For ninety-one eons,
the fruit I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My defilements are burnt up,
I live without defilements.
It was good for me to come,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Udumbaraphaladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā udumbaraphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Udumbaraphaladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai udumbaraphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽udumbaraphaladāyaka therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Udumbaraphaladāyaka’s Story is the third.
